commentary.text: Welcome back. Shah Rukh waves to the crowd
Vinay: "Amazing bowling by Akshar patel, Economy of 2.75 is just superb. Spell like these often goes under the radar, hope this be the defining spell of the match. Beat that Narine if you can!!"
Morkel to Sehwag,2 runs,Sehwag wastes no time in going for the big hit - at least trying, this was miscued and it lands over cover
Morkel to Sehwag,1 leg bye,swings it towards the pads and he knocks it off the pads to square leg
Morkel to Vohra,no run,Vohra is squared up by one that moved away late off the pitch, pokes his bat out
Morkel to Vohra,no run,this is top class bowling by Morkel, the previous one moved away and this one came back in and still squared him up, gets good bounce as well
Morkel to Vohra,2 runs,Vohra gets bat on ball and it's a stylish flick over square leg but it drops short of the rope, didn't time it very well
Morkel to Vohra,no run,edged and drops short of slip, good delivery coming back in and he gets an outside edge that goes on the first bounce

Sudipta: "@Vinay, its true that NArine most likely wont be able to better Akshar's economy. But KKR has to make sure bowlers other than Narine bowl at good economy too, which no one in Kings XI did apart from Akshar. So, supporting cast is the key to me for KKR."

UT Yadav to Sehwag, $$OUT$$ ,that rocketed off the bat but straight to Shakib at cover, this was a pacy delivery by Umesh, short of a length, Sehwag had the width to punch it away but couldn't clear the infield, Shakib held his nerve and caught it with both hands
UT Yadav to Saha,no run,this was full and moving away and he drives to cover
UT Yadav to Saha,1 wide,he slides this one wide down the leg side

UT Yadav to Saha,no run,appeal for a caught behind! Another good delivery by Umesh, this was pitched up and straightening and Saha was pushing at it, confident appeal, replays indicated a sound, Llong not convinced, lucky Saha, he looked back as well
UT Yadav to Saha,1 run
UT Yadav to Vohra,1 run,he pushes it down to cover
UT Yadav to Saha,no run,down the leg side, swings and misses
Morkel to Vohra,1 run,clips it just wide of mid-on
Morkel to Saha,no run,he gets across and punches it to the off side
Morkel to Saha,no run,he stays beside the line and pushes it towards backward point
Morkel to Saha,2 runs,this was a fuller ball on the stumps and he shuffles and works it away down to deep midwicket
Morkel to Saha,no run,appeal for an lbw, Morkel has him in a tangle, yorker length and he is struck on the base of the pad, maybe sliding down leg
Morkel to Saha, $$SIX$$ ,that was a really good pick-up shot, fuller length on the pads, he shuffles and easily flicks it over fine leg
Rain in the air again
Narine to Vohra,no run,slides down the leg side and he paddles it to short fine leg
Narine to Vohra,no run,just slides on the pads

The covers are coming on and there's confusion! The players were gesturing to the staff to keep the covers away. Not sure what the umpires were doing. They have gone back anmd at the end of 5 overs KXIP need to be 37 for the par score
Narine to Vohra,1 run,length ball on middle and leg and tucked to fine leg
Narine to Saha,1 run,clipped softly towards midwicket and they think of a second but there's a fumble, not worth risking
Narine to Vohra,1 run,keeps it quiet, pushed towards mid-on

Narine to Saha, $$FOUR$$ ,fine shot to end the over and crucial too as Punjab look to be at least 37 at the end of 5 overs for the par score, on the pads and he gets on his knee and sweeps powerfully over square leg
Shakib Al Hasan to Vohra, $$SIX$$ ,the initial target of 38 getting closer! Tossed up and he gets on his knee and slogs him clean over deep midwicket
Shakib Al Hasan to Vohra, $$SIX$$ ,back to baclk! Tossed up and he comes forward and launches it high and over wide long-on
Shakib Al Hasan to Vohra,1 run,down the track and he pushes it towards cover, they are on par with the par score of 37
Shakib Al Hasan to Saha,no run,he makes room and cuts it down to point and can't get the single
Shakib Al Hasan to Saha,1 run,with that sweep to fine leg Kings XI have gone past the D/L score for five overs
Shakib Al Hasan to Vohra,1 run,he tucks it wide of square leg and we have a match on, it's drizzling, Kings XI get one thing out of the way
Iqbal: "Very silly captaincy to bowl shakib when only 14 needed of this over. should have continued with morkel!!
Morkel to Vohra,no run,pulls a length ball straight to mid-on
Morkel to Vohra, $$SIX$$ ,that was effortless! He gets forward and then goes back and launches a full ball with ease over long-on, free swing was enough
Morkel to Vohra,no run,fullish in length and he pushes it straight to mid-off
Morkel to Vohra,no run,shorter delivery from Morkel and he arches back and swishes but misses

Morkel to Vohra, $$OUT$$ ,good catch by Yadav and how crucial will that be? Short of a length and Vohra was looking at the long-on boundary again, he miscues the pull and it's high in the air, Yadav backpedals from mid-on and takes it on the fall
The par score after 6 ov is 49
Morkel to Saha,1 wide,wide down the leg side, KKR can't give them an opening like this
Morkel to Saha,no run,fortunately for KKR it's not a boundary, full ball on the stumps pushed to mid-on
Narine to Maxwell,1 run,Maxwell v Narine Ball 1 - he quietly pushes it towards mid-on
Narine to Saha,1 run,Saha too quietly tucks it to the on side and settles for the single
Narine to Maxwell, $$FOUR$$ ,Maxwell targets the leg side and succeeds, length ball and he gets on his knee early and sweeps and one bounce to fine leg
Narine to Maxwell,no run,gets forward and pushes it towards mid-off
Narine to Maxwell,no run,good comeback by Narine as he sees him come down and bowls the off break, it turns and he is forced to check his shot
Narine to Maxwell,1 run,swings it hard but finds short fine leg
UT Yadav to Maxwell,1 leg bye,confident shout for an lbw! This one nipped back in sharply and hit him high on the pad at the top flap, maybe a bit too high and Llong not convinced
Gururajan: "Should be interesting to see how Maxwell plays once DL score is achieved - cant slog and risk losing wicket"
UT Yadav to Saha,1 run,short one on the body and he swivels to pull and he miscues it, fine leg picks up
UT Yadav to Maxwell,no run,Maxwell gives him the charge and misses it completely, nowhere near the ball
UT Yadav to Maxwell,no run,that's a good slower ball! Maxwell made room and was miles away from the ball
Saha studies the D/L sheet, pulls it out of his pocket

UT Yadav to Maxwell, $$OUT$$ ,he's got the Big Fish! This was quite straightforward, Yadav was angling it towards the leg stump, Maxwell shuffled and looked to paddle it, exposed the leg stump, struck in front and an easy decision
$$The$$ $$par$$ $$score$$ $$at$$ $$this$$ $$point$$ $$is$$ $$66$$
And it's the Time Out
UT Yadav to Miller,no run,this was fuller in length outside off and he drives to cover
Raghu Ifmr: "Who was that playing in the middle disguised as Glenn Maxwell in the middle.. Courtney Walsh??? No other explanation for his atrocious stay.."
Chawla to Saha,1 run,gets turn straightaway and he cuts to cover
It's still drizzling

Chawla to Miller,1 leg bye,that was a good shout for lbw! Pitched on the off stump and turning back in slightly and Miller was a long way forward, looked like it would hit the middle stump, Miller was lucky
Chawla to Saha,1 run,sweeps him down to fine leg, Kings XI need boundaries
Chawla to Miller,1 run,stays back and clips it towards midwicket
Chawla to Saha,1 run,works it towards deep square leg
Chawla to Miller,no run,gets on his knee and looks to sweep but doesn't make contact
UT Yadav to Saha, $$FOUR$$ ,a boundary at last, length ball and Saha fetches that from off stump and swings it towards deep midwicket, Yadav dives near the rope but can't stop it
UT Yadav to Saha,no run,keeps it nice and straight and he pushes it down the track
UT Yadav to Saha,no run,the off cutter from Yadav and he was beaten
Par score at this point is 76
UT Yadav to Saha,1 run,fullish on the pads and he works it down to midwicket
UT Yadav to Miller,1 run, $$Dropped$$  but a tough one for Pandey! This was short and wide outside off, Miller slashed hard to Pandey's right and he did really well to stop a boundary
UT Yadav to Saha,2 runs,on the pads and he works it away behind square leg and they hurry the second run, Uthappa breaks the stumps but he is home
Chawla to Miller,no run,short and wide and he looks to cut but misses
Chawla to Miller,1 run,drifts on the pads and he works it to deep square leg
Chawla to Saha, $$SIX$$ ,that's a clean slog! Tossed up and he gets on his knee and sends it a few rows over deep midwicket
Chawla to Saha,1 run,bowls it short and he pulls him to deep midwicket
Chawla to Miller,1 run,gets forward and drives him to long-off
Chawla to Saha,no run,this was flatter and shorter and he looks to cut, ball keeps low and he misses
Morkel to Miller,1 run,Morkel bangs it in short to Miller and he does well to keep it down and pull it to square leg
Morkel to Saha,1 run,fetched that from wide outside off and looks to pull but gets an inside edge
Avik: "Gambhir is running short of bowlers and has to bring in Shakib soon. Interesting to see how much Kings XI can extract from his overs."
Morkel to Miller,1 run,he sees Miller advancing and cramps him up for room and he has to settle for a drill to long-on
Morkel to Saha,no run,looks to beat the off side field  but can't beat backward point
The par score now is 91
Morkel to Saha,no run,the Morne slower bouncer again, he doesn't pick it well and he swings and misses

Morkel to Saha, $$OUT$$ ,Kings XI are pegged back further here, found mid-off with precision, this was a fuller ball on the stumps and Saha made room to free his arms, got his placement all wrong as he scooped it straight to Umesh
The par score now is 97
Chawla to Miller,2 runs,tossed up and he comes forward and drives this to mid-on

Chawla to Miller, $$OUT$$ ,Chawla hits the timber with a sharp leg break, round the wicket, he bowled it flatter and Miller went back and across and looked to cut against the spin, comes back and castles middle and off
Akshar and Bailey are yet to face a ball.
Chawla to Bailey,no run,Bailey stays back and quietly defends this one
Chawla to Bailey,2 runs,he comes down the track and clips it wide of midwicket and scamper back for two
Chawla to Bailey,1 run,flatter and shorter and he rocks back and cuts to sweeper cover
Chawla to Patel,1 run,gives him width and he goes back and cuts to deep point
It's the Time Out
Chaitu: "Looks like Punjab is going to be the Delhi of 2012. Topping league stage and not making to the finals!!"
Vibhash Awasthi: "Is it like twice in 3 years, KKR will be playing IPL final? I'm telling you. He has got magic in him. He, Piyush Chawla - the lucky mascot, part of T20WC2007 and WC11."
Here's Shakib
Shakib Al Hasan to Patel,1 run,bowls it flat and he goes back and flicks to deep midwicket
Shakib Al Hasan to Bailey,no run,good bowling, he comes down the track and has to check his shot
Rain has stopped so we can forget about D/L for now

Shakib Al Hasan to Bailey, $$OUT$$ ,We have a run out and Chawla is the man, Bailey pulls it to short fine leg and they risk the single, Akshar was struggling and Chawla fired the throw to Uthappa who broke the stumps before Akshar dived
Shakib Al Hasan to Dhawan,no run,very slow through the air and he can only defend
Shakib Al Hasan to Dhawan,no run,slower through the air again and he can only push it to the off side
Shakib Al Hasan to Dhawan,1 run,tossed up and he drives him to mid-off
KKR grinding Kings XI down here
Chawla to Dhawan,no run,full and driven straight to cover
Chawla to Dhawan,1 run,down the track and he is forced to check his shot, he gets an inside edge
Chawla to Bailey,1 run,he comes down the track and drills this down to long-off
Chawla to Dhawan,1 run,he comes down the track and drives him to cover
Ashvini: "If they lose this match, KXIP will be praying hard for Chennai to beat Mumbai!!! Mumbai has defeated KXIP in both the league matches."
Chawla to Bailey,1 run,drops it short and he goes back and punches it to cover
Chawla to Dhawan,no run,nearly lobbed to the fielder, he made room and looked to cut but got an outside edge towards point
Shakib Al Hasan to Bailey,1 run,tossed up on the stumps and swept towards fine leg
Shakib Al Hasan to Dhawan,1 run,he makes room and punches it down to mid-off
Shakib Al Hasan to Bailey,1 run,he comes down the track and lofts it down to wide long-on
Shakib Al Hasan to Dhawan,no run,good bowling, no room to free his arms, pushes it back to the bowler
Shakib Al Hasan to Dhawan,1 run,he gets forward and sweeps but only a single
Shakib Al Hasan to Bailey,1 run,gets forward and pushes it down to long-off
Narine to Bailey, $$FOUR$$ ,is it too late? This was a short one from Narine outside off asking to be hit, he punches it hard down to deep cover
Narine to Bailey,1 run,stays back and mistimes it towards mid-on, it was in the air
Narine to Dhawan,no run,Dhawan was looking to slow that from outside off and he missed it completely
Narine to Dhawan,1 run,on the pads and clips it over midwicket
Narine to Bailey,no run,Bailey makes room and looks to smash it through the off side and misses
Narine to Bailey, $$SIX$$ ,he finally connects well, tossed up on the off stump and he gets on his knee and sends it a few rows over deep midwicket

Badhri: "@Ashvini Not sure about that. Beating Chennai in a knock out game is not the same as beating them in two league games. Chennai are BIG match players and have been in the last 4 finals, remember."
Shakib Al Hasan to Dhawan,2 runs,full ball and he drives to wide long-off and Suryakumar does well to slide and cut it off, nearly fluffed it
Shakib Al Hasan to Dhawan, $$SIX$$ ,palmed over the rope! On the leg stump and he slogs it flat down to fine leg and Umesh was at the edge and it was over his head but he couldn't hang on
Shakib Al Hasan to Dhawan, $$OUT$$ ,an easy stumping, Dhawan was down the pitch looking to hit out, the ball skidded through, beat him and Uthappa did the rest
Shakib Al Hasan to Johnson, $$SIX$$ ,swings the first ball away! Tossed up on middle and he gets on his knee and deposits it a few rows over wide long-on
Shakib Al Hasan to Johnson,1 run
Shakib Al Hasan to Bailey, $$SIX$$ ,two in the over! This was a low full toss and Bailey was down the track and sent it a few rows over deep midwicket
Narine to Johnson,no run,Johnson looks to slog this away, big offcutter and he misses
Narine to Johnson,no run,sharp turn again and he made room and looked to slash but missed
Narine to Johnson,2 runs,skidded through and he punched it to the off side
Narine to Johnson,1 run,swings and only gets an outside edge, Kings XI really struggling
Narine to Bailey,1 run,this one stopped on him as he miscued the pull to the vacant area at square leg
Narine to Johnson,no run,how do you out him away? Another swing and a miss against an off break
30 off the final over.  Umesh will have to bowl the worst over of his life if KKR are to lose this
Shri: "3 sixes in an over by 3 different batsmen....how many times we have seen this before?"
UT Yadav to Bailey, $$OUT$$ ,Umesh begins the over by getting rid of Bailey, this was a length ball on the off stump and he looked to swing this over long-on but he picked Pandey, easy take
UT Yadav to Karanveer Singh,1 run,fires a length ball on the stumps and he makes room to push it to cover and only a single
UT Yadav to Johnson,no run,slower one to Johnson and he makes room to swing and misses
UT Yadav to Johnson,no run,that's a good bouncer, really quick for Johnson and he swings and misses
UT Yadav to Johnson,no run,this was fired outside off and he made room to slap this but missed
UT Yadav to Johnson,no run,and ends the formalities with a slower ball and Johnson makes room but can't get bat on ball, no use - Kings XI have been caught napping at Eden tonight
Okay well looks like the presentation will not be shown. The Mumbai game is underway. We will try and get you the Man of the Match as soon as possible. Umesh a strong contender.

Just heard that  $$Umesh$$ $$Yadav$$ $$is$$ $$the$$ $$Man$$ $$of$$ $$the$$ $$Match$$ . No presentation on TV. You can catch the latest from the Mumbai game. Thanks for your company. Enjoy the Eliminator!

$$End$$ $$of$$ $$match$$ : So KKR are the first team to make the final of IPL 2014. Kings XI have lost but they are not out of it yet. They will have another crack at the final when they meet the winner of the eliminator between Mumbai Indians and Chennai Super Kings, about to take place in Mumbai. Kings XI's second chance will be on Friday.

8 wins on the trot for KKR. At this point they look primed to lift the trophy. Kings XI's defeat has added to the intrigue.  We will have to wait a bit for the presentation once the Mumbai toss is out of the way.
Vidhu: "Its time KXIP should get Marsh and rest one bowler. They anyways are not able to restrict teams to a low total."

name: Kings XI Punjab v Kolkata Knight Riders
